<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 118, 379, 144]]<|/det|>
# Cambridge IGCSE™  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 170, 183, 187]]<|/det|>
## PHYSICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 194, 332, 210]]<|/det|>
Paper 1 Multiple Choice (Core)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[782, 170, 905, 186]]<|/det|>
0625/13  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[782, 194, 905, 210]]<|/det|>
May/June 2023  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[814, 217, 905, 231]]<|/det|>
45 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 247, 507, 263]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the multiple choice answer sheet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 277, 437, 293]]<|/det|>
You will need: Multiple choice answer sheet  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[215, 291, 539, 320]]<|/det|>
Soft clean eraser Soft pencil (type B or HB is recommended)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 337, 228, 352]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 354, 880, 522]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- There are forty questions on this paper. Answer all questions.- For each question there are four possible answers A, B, C and D. Choose the one you consider correct and record your choice in soft pencil on the multiple choice answer sheet.- Follow the instructions on the multiple choice answer sheet.- Write in soft pencil.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number on the multiple choice answer sheet in the spaces provided unless this has been done for you.- Do not use correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You may use a calculator.- Take the weight of \(1.0 \text{kg}\) to be \(9.8 \text{N}\) (acceleration of free fall \(= 9.8 \text{m/s}^2\)).  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 549, 220, 564]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 565, 570, 612]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 40.- Each correct answer will score one mark.- Any rough working should be done on this question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[269, 848, 728, 865]]<|/det|>
This document has 16 pages. Any blank pages are indicated.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 865, 91]]<|/det|>

conduction, convection and radiation

<label>17</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 485, 784, 504]]<|/det|>
A drop of water from a tap falls onto the surface of some water of constant depth.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[329, 512, 665, 641]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 655, 549, 673]]<|/det|>
Water waves spread out on the surface of the water.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 685, 348, 702]]<|/det|>
Which statement is correct?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 713, 133, 731]]<|/det|>
<label>A</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 713, 752, 731]]<|/det|>
The waves are longitudinal and travel at the same speed in all directions.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 740, 133, 757]]<|/det|>
<label>B</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 740, 824, 757]]<|/det|>
The waves are longitudinal and travel more quickly in one direction than in others.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 766, 133, 785]]<|/det|>
<label>C</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 766, 745, 784]]<|/det|>
The waves are transverse and travel at the same speed in all directions.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 793, 133, 811]]<|/det|>
<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 793, 816, 811]]<|/det|>
The waves are transverse and travel more quickly in one direction than in others.
